quiz.text: The balance of exports and imports of goods is referred to as:
options: Current account
Current account balance
Current account deficit
Trade balance
Capital account Surplus

quiz.text: Which country among the following is the largest importer of Indian tea?
options: USA
Russia
France
Germany
Belarus

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect about India's 'Act East Policy' ?
options: This policy focuses on the extended neighbourhood in Asia-Pacific region.
This policy was originally conceived as an economic initiative.
This policy promotes enhanced connectivity to Asia-Pacific region through North-Eastern Region.
This policy promotes proactive diplomacy with political and military intervention to curb insurgency in the Asia-Pacific and Indian Ocean Region
None of the above

quiz.text: Since 2014-15, India has consistently run trade surplus with which one among the following countries?
options: China
Saudi Arabia
USA
Germany
Pakistan

quiz.text:
With reference to the international trade of India at present, which of the following statements is/are correct? 
  1. India's merchandise exports are less than its merchandise imports. 
  2. India's imports of iron and steel, chemicals, fertilizers, and machinery have decreased in recent years. 
  3. India's exports of services are more than its imports of services. 
  4. India suffers from an overall trade/current deficit. 
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 4 only
3 only
1, 3 and 4 only
2 only

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the External Debt of India:
  1. Bilateral debt is the largest component of the external debt of India
  2. More than 90 percent of the external debt is denominated in US dollars.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding a country’s Terms of Trade (ToT):
  1. It is the ratio between the index of export prices and the index of import prices.
  2. A country’s ToT is less than a hundred percent if more capital is leaving the country than is entering into it.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: 1  only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text: Free Trade Policy refers to a policy where there is
options: Little or No restriction on the movements of goods
Restriction on the movements of goods
Existence of anti-dumping policy
Encouragement for balances growth
None of the above

quiz.text: Special Economic Zones (SEZ) have been created the first time in the:
options: EXIM Policy, 2000
EXIM Policy, 2005
Industrial Policy, 1956
Industrial Policy, 1991
Special Environment Zone Act 2007

quiz.text: FEMA (Foreign Exchange Management Act) was finally implemented in the year
options: 1991
1997
2000
2007
2009

quiz.text: A trade policy consists of
options: Export-Import Policy
Licencing Policy
Foreign Exchange Policy
Balance of Payment Policy
Both A and B

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is NOT correct about foreign trade policy?
options: It is announced every 5 years
It is also known as EXIM policy
It is administered by the Ministry of finance
The latest foreign trade policy 2021-2026
None of the above

quiz.text: The practice of selling goods in a foreign country at a price below their domestic selling price is called
options: Diplomacy
Discrimination
Dumping
Double pricing
Double Taxation

quiz.text: At present as per government rulings, the maximum area allowed for a multi- product Special Economic Zone (SEZ) is
options: 2000 hectares
3000 hectares
4000 hectares
5000 hectares
6000 hectares

quiz.text:
Which of the following areas of business regulation are covered in the Doing Business Report (DB) of the World Bank?
  1. Getting Electricity
  2. Protecting Minority Investors
  3. Resolving Insolvency
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1  only
All of the above

quiz.text: The term “Autarky” is related to which of the following?
options: International trade
Agriculture sector
Banking sector
Insurance sector
None of the above

quiz.text: Special Economic Zone (SEZ) Act became effective in
options: 2004
2005
2006
2007
2009

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) organization:
  1. Its mandate is to formulate and implement the Foreign Trade Policy with the main objective of promoting India’s exports.
  2. It is an attached office of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: 1 only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text: In which one of the following places was Asia's first Export Processing Zone (EPZ) set up ?
options: Santa Cruz
Cochin
Surat
Kandla
Mumbai

quiz.text:
The Export-Import Bank of India (EXIM) extends Lines of Credit (LOCs) to promote export and imports. Which of the following is/are eligible for EXIM Lines of Credits?
  1. Overseas financial institutions
  2. Regional development banks
  3. Sovereign governments
Select the correct answer using the codes given below:
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
2 only

quiz.text: “FERA and FEMA” are often seen in the news, are related to which of the following?
options: Foreign funding
Bilateral trade relations
Financial inclusion
Foreign exchange
None of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the “Export Credit Guarantee Corporation (ECGC)”:
  1. It was established in the 2nd five-year plan to promote exports.
  2. It is managed by a Board of Directors comprising representatives of the Government, Reserve Bank of India, banking, and insurance and exporting community.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: 1 only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text: As per the present policy, what is the percentage of Foreign Direct Investment permitted in total equity for the Multi-Brand Retails Trading Sector?
options: 51%
49%
26%
100%
65%

quiz.text:
The SEZ Act 2005, which came into effect in February, 2006 has certain objectives. In this context, consider the following
  1. Development of infrastructure facilities.
  2. Promotion of investment from foreign sources.
  3. Promotion of export of services only.
Which of the above are objectives of this Act?
options: 2 only
3 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 2 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text:
Since the introduction of planning in the country, India had to depend heavily on the imports of various types of machineries and equipment’s for the development of various types of industries in the country. Such imports were known as developmental imports. At that stage, India had to import capital goods extensively in order to set up various industries like steel plants, locomotives, hydro-electric projects etc. In the next stage, India had to import a huge quantity of intermediate goods and raw materials in order to utilize the productive capacity developed in the initial periods. This type of imports was known as maintenance imports.

Thus the developmental process of a developing country like India in its initial stages was very much depending on developmental and maintenance imports. Moreover, in order to meet the scarcity of some essential commodities, the government has also imported food grains and other consumer goods. This type of imports was considered as anti-inflationary imports. In order to meet its mounting import bill, the country started to export various types of primary products at initial stage.

But with the growth of various types of manufacturing industries and engineering industries, the country started to withdraw these traditional items of export and gradually established a good market for its manufactured and semi-manufactured commodities. Thus foreign trade has been helping the country in different stages of its economic development.

Q. The tax on import and export is known as
options: Income tax
Trade tax
Custom tax
Value added Tax
Excise tax

Q. Where is the Indian Institute of foreign trade located?
options: New Delhi
Hyderabad
Mumbai
Ahmedabad
Bangalore

Thus foreign trade has been helping the country in different stages of its economic development Q. Which of the following is/are a potential advantage(s) of the Foreign Direct Investment?
  1. Exchange Rate Stability 
  2. Increase in Exports
  3. Human Resource Development
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
All of the above
1 only

Which of the following is/are not covered by the definition of ‘foreign source’ under the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, 2010? 
  1. Government of any foreign country
  2. International Monetary Fund
  3. Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change 
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
All of the above
1 Only
